alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:54AM EDT until March 27 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County. .A strong storm system moving slowly across the region has produced widespread moderate to heavy rainfall across the region. This rainfall is resulting in rivers and streams to rise rapidly. More rain is forecast in association with this weather system over the4 next 24 to 36 hours.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-250300- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0002.230324T2308Z-230327T1800Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.230324T2308Z.230326T0600Z.230327T1200Z.NO/ 1054 AM EDT Fri Mar 24 2023 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 12.3 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
